2025-02-05.title: TotalEnergies Shrugs Off Weaker Profits by Lifting Dividend, Maintaining Buybacks
2025-02-05.description: TotalEnergies SE raised its dividend and maintained the pace of share buybacks, shrugging off a drop in fourth-quarter earnings caused by weaker oil prices and shrinking refining margins.

2025-01-22.title: TotalEnergies Hired DC Lobbyist in Bid to Revive Mozambique LNG
2025-01-22.description: TotalEnergies SE hired a Washington lobbyist to help approve key export financing in an effort to revive its Mozambique liquefied natural gas project, which has been on hold for years due to security threats.

2025-01-23.title: Total CEO Urges EU to Back Corporate Champions, Shield Markets
2025-01-23.description: TotalEnergies SE Chief Executive Officer Patrick Pouyanne urged the European Union to amend regulations to foster corporate “champions” in the key fields of technology, banking and energy, and to protect them when needed amid rising competition from the US an…

2025-02-18.title: TotalEnergies, Air Liquide Plan €600 Million Hydrogen Venture
2025-02-18.description: TotalEnergies SE and Air Liquide SA plan a €600 million ($628 million) joint venture to produce green hydrogen for the French oil giant’s refinery in the Netherlands, along with a supply deal for its petrochemical plant in Belgium.

2025-03-12.title: TotalEnergies’ Mozambique LNG Poised for Decision on $4.7 Billion US Loan
2025-03-12.description: TotalEnergies SE’s $20 billion liquefied natural gas facility in Mozambique is poised for a decision on Thursday over key financing by the US Export-Import Bank.

2025-03-14.title: US Exim Approves $4.7 Billion Loan for Total’s Mozambique LNG
2025-03-14.description: The US Export-Import Bank’s board approved a $4.7 billion loan that makes up the biggest piece of financing for TotalEnergies SE’s Mozambique LNG project, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

2025-03-19.title: TotalEnergies Eyes Brazil Green Hydrogen for European Refineries
2025-03-19.description: TotalEnergies SE is considering importing green hydrogen from a multi-billion dollar project under development in northeastern Brazil to supply its European refineries.

2025-03-20.title: Nigerian Oil Block Winner That Outbid Majors Owned by Tech Firm
2025-03-20.description: A Nigerian oil company, controlled by a computer services firm, that outbid TotalEnergies SE and Chevron Corp for blocks last year, is among emerging local companies taking over the nation’s crude fields.
